description:
The Chat Messaging Lite plugin allows you to create dynamic chat bubbles within your Bubble app, enhancing the messaging experience. You can customize the appearance, alignment, and behavior of the chat bubbles, providing a responsive and visually appealing chat interface for users.

ðŸ”” For more advanced chat functionality check out our Air Chat & Messaging Pro plugin which is more advanced than this free plugin and comes with a host of powerful features: https://zeroqode.com/plugin/air-chat--messaging-pro-plugin-for-bubble-1648558551745x653956242427235000                                                  

[b]Usage Features:[/b] 

- Adjust the background color, border radius, and alignment (left or right) to match your app's style.
- Supports custom fonts, font sizes, colors, and text formatting options for chat content.
- Easily display dynamic text from your database or workflows, making each chat bubble interactive and personalized.
- Control the size and position of chat bubbles within the layout, ensuring they fit any screen size or design.
- Drag and drop the Chat Bubble element onto your page, set up the necessary dynamic fields, and start using it instantly.

[size=5][b]FAQ[/b][/size]

-[b]How do I align chat bubbles?[/b] 
You can align chat bubbles to either the left or right by selecting the desired option under the "Bubble Alignment" dropdown in the plugin's settings.

- [b]Can I use dynamic text within the chat bubble?[/b] 
Yes, simply link the text field to dynamic data from your database or workflows to display live messages within the chat bubble.

-[b] How can I change the background color of the chat bubble?[/b] 
You can modify the background color in the plugin settings under the "Background Color" field. This allows for full customization to match your app's theme.

- [b]Is it possible to adjust the font and text style in chat bubbles?[/b] 
Absolutely! The plugin supports custom font selection, font size, and text styling options (bold, italic, underline) for complete control over the chat appearance.

- [b]Why aren't my chat bubbles appearing as expected?[/b] 
Ensure that the dynamic data linked to the chat bubble's text field is correct and that the element is set to be visible on page load. Double-check the layout and alignment settings to confirm they fit your design requirements.

plugin_instructions:
The chat bubble element will most likely be placed twice inside your repeating group. You will want to hide/show one of them based on who sent the message. 
In the editor, make the element be as wide as you want the chat bubble to be, style it and then set the text value.
